newsitem.title: USA: Informix offers intranet database system.
newsitem.headline: Informix offers intranet database system.

text.p: Informix Software Inc said Monday it is offering its Informix-OnLine Workgroup Server database system for Microsoft Corp's Window NT 4.0 and various UNIX platforms operating systems.
Separately, Informix said the OnLine Workgroup Server system would be the database platform in a new package of ready-to-use corporate intranet applications from Netscape Communications Corp.
It said the OnLine Workgroup Server would provide the database for Netscape's AppFoundry, a collection of reusable tools for building network-based corporate intranet sofware.
Informix noted that it is the first relational database vendor to ship database software supporting Microsoft's new Windows NT operating system.
UNIX support for OnLine Workgroup Server is immediately available for Sun Microsystems Inc's Solaris 2.5 operating environment for its UltraSPARC system and for Windows NT 4.0.

It said support for International Business Machines Corp's AIX 4.1, Santa Cruz Operation Corp's SCO OpenServer Release 5, and Hewlett-Packard Co's HP-UX 10.x and Solaris 2.5 operating environment for Intel is scheduled to be available early in the fourth quarter of 1996.

Combined with Netscape's market-leading FastTrack Server software and Netscape Navigator 3.0 client software, the INFORMIX-OnLine Workgroup Server enables companies to share and distribute information cost-effectively and quickly, via client/server or intranet applications.

The INFORMIX-OnLine Workgroup Server for both NT and UNIX is priced at $295 per user, with a five-user minimum. Informix also offers an Internet-based, unlimited-user license priced at $6,000 per central computer.
Informix stock was among the most active issues on the Nasdaq, trading up 1-1/4 at 27-1/2 at midday Monday on volume of 3.1 million shares.
Netscape stock rose 4-3/8 points to 43-1/8 at midday.
